org.jsimpledb.kv

Class KeyRange

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jsimpledb.kv.KeyRange

  • public class KeyRange
extends Object
    Represents a range of byte[] keys sorted in unsigned lexical order. Either bound may be specified as null to represent no minimum or no maximum (respectively).

    Instances are immutable: the minimum and maximum byte[] arrays are copied during construction and when accessed by getMin() and getMax().

      • min

        protected final byte[] min
        Lower bound (inclusive), or null for no minimum. Subclasses must not modify the array (to preserve immutability).

      • max

        protected final byte[] max
        Upper bound (exclusive), or null for no maximum. Subclasses must not modify the array (to preserve immutability).

    • Constructor Detail

      • KeyRange

        public KeyRange(byte[] min,
                byte[] max)
        Constructor.

        Note: a min with length zero is treated as if it were null.

        Parameters:
        min - minimum key (inclusive), or empty or null for no minimum
        max - maximum key (exclusive), or null for no maximum
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if min > max

      • KeyRange

        public KeyRange(byte[] key)
        Construct key range containing a single key.
        Parameters:
        key - the key contained in the range
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if key is null

        public KeyRange prefixedBy(byte[] prefix)

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(byte[] key)
        Determine if this range is left of, contains, or is right of the given key.
        Parameters:
        key - key for comparison
        Returns:
        -1 if this range is left of key, 0 if this range contains key, or 1 if this range is right of key,
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if key is null

      • compare

        public static int compare(byte[] key1,
                          boolean type1,
                          byte[] key2,
                          boolean type2)
        Compare two byte[] keys using unsigned lexical ordering, while also accepting null values that represent "negative infinity" and "positive infinity".
        Parameters:
        key1 - first key
        type1 - how to interpret key1 if value is null: MIN (for "negative infinity") or MAX (for "positive infinity")
        key2 - second key
        type2 - how to interpret key2 if value is null: MIN (for "negative infinity") or MAX (for "positive infinity")
        Returns:
        -1 if key1 < key2, 1 if key1 > key2, or zero if key1 = key2
